Module contents¶

Submodules¶

vegphenome.basephenome.vegPhenBase module¶

class vegphenome.basephenome.vegPhenBase.VEGPHENOMEBASE(ppx=None, ppy=None)¶

Bases: object

Base Phenotyping class. Provides basic phenotype measurements. Each Veg can ingherit and modify the methods of this class

blockiness(top, bottom, ign_pct=20)¶

Find Blockiness (Width of fruits at start mid and end of fruit)

Parameters

  • tops (List[Points]) – Top boundary of fruit

  • bottoms (List[Points]) – Lower boundary of fruit

  • ign_pct (int, optional) – Percentage to ignore top and bottom of fruit. Defaults to 20.

Returns

Returns bottom, mid and top width of fruit

Return type

[tuple([[Point,Point],[Point,Point],[Point,Point]])]

box_fit_normalized(mask)¶

Normalized Box Fitting. Draw box to image and find IoU between mask and drawn box. The vaue returned is 1-Iou varies between 0 and 1. 0 means no error and 1 means maximum error

Parameters

mask ([np.array]) – Gray scale mask image of patch

Returns

1-IoU

Return type

[int]

convert_pixels_to_measure(items, labels)¶
Convert pixels to real units cmm/mm if ppx and ppy are defined otherwise find lengths of curves. Labels are used to determine how to convert for area,

perimeter and points

Parameters

  • items ([List]) – List of items for conversion

  • labels ([List]) – Labels for items

Returns

Returns list of results converted real world distance

Return type

[List]

ellipse_fitting_normalized(mask)¶

Normalized Ellipse Fitting. Fits ellipse to contour. Draw ellipse to image and find IoU between mask and drawn ellipse. The vaue returned is 1-Iou varies between 0 and 1. 0 means no error and 1 means maximum error

Parameters

mask ([np.array]) – Gray scale mask image of patch

Returns

1 - Iou

Return type

[int]

eucledian_distance(points)¶

Calculates eucledian distance for list of points

Parameters

  • points ([List(Tupe)]) – List of points to calculate the eucledian distance

  • ppx ([float]) – Optional. scaling factor to convert from image to real world distance

  • ppy ([float]) – Optional. scaling factor to convert from image to real world distance

Returns

Returns float eucledian distance

Return type

[float]

find_curve_height(top, bottom, mask, ign_pct=15)¶

Find curved height of patch. Find mid point of patch ignoring the start and end given ignore percentage and then extend to both sides Curved Height >= Mid Height

Parameters

  • tops (List[Points]) – Top boundary of fruit

  • bottoms (List[Points]) – Lower boundary of fruit

  • mask ([np.array]) – gray scale image for extending the curved height to boundaries

  • ign_pct (int, optional) – %age of fruit to ignore from start and end. Defaults to 15.

Returns

List of points constituting the curved height

Return type

[List[Points]]

find_max_height(xs, ys)¶

Find Max height of fruit. Height is defined across x dimension. :param xs: All sorted xs :type xs: Union[list, np.array()] :param ys: All sorted ys :type ys: Union[list, np.array()]

Returns

[height_points, max_height]

Return type

[Tuple(List,int)]

Return Max width of patch

Parameters

  • tops (List[Points]) – Top boundary of fruit

  • bottoms (List[Points]) – Lower boundary of fruit

Returns

[Max Width Points, Max Width]

Return type

[Tuple(List[Points],int)]

  • bottoms (List[Points]) – Lower boundary of fruit

get_color(patch, points)¶

Get color of patch given a mask image, Returns Mean R,G,B and Mean L,A,B of patch

Parameters

  • patch ([np.array]) – Color image patch of size H,W,3

  • points ([np.array]) – Points to calcualte the color from

Returns

[(MeanR,MeanG,MeanB),(MeanL,MeanA,MeanB)]

Return type

[List]

min_max_segment(ref, xs, ys)¶

Calculate min, max of a patch. Take a reference point x and calculate min and max y for it

Parameters

  • int (ref) – Reference x for which we need to find min and max y

  • xs (Union[list, np.array()]) – All sorted xs

  • ys (Union[list, np.array()]) – All sorted ys

Returns

[segment_point_min,segment_point_max,Segment_width]

Return type

[Tuple(List,int)]

static ray_trace_segment(img, init, direction='y', to_origin=True)¶

Ray trace from the inital points to some end like end of non zero pixels in image. Is useful for fruits that turns and make an S shape

Parameters

  • img ([np.array(H,W)]) – Gray scale Image of dim HxW

  • init ([int]) – Point coordinate x or y to start the ray tracing from

  • direction (str, optional) – [description]. Direction to move to the ray trace. Defaults to “y”.

  • to_origin (int, optional) – [description]. To go to origin or not(For x direction origin is to left). Defaults to True.

Returns

List of ray traced points

Return type

[List[Points]]

Check and perform sanity tests on results

Parameters

inp ([dict]) – Results dictionray

vegphenome.basephenome.utils.merge_results(inp, save_path='.')¶

Change the column names/ keys of dict according to FTS supported colimns and merge the images to plots. Finally saves the results as xls

Parameters

  • inp ([Dict]) – Results dict to be merged and saved

  • save_path (str, optional) – [description]. Defaults to “.”.

vegphenome.basephenome.utils.save_dictionary_to_xls(inp, save_path='.', name='output.xlsx')¶

Save Dict results to xls using pandas

Parameters

  • inp ([dict]) – Dict of results

  • save_path (str, optional) – [description]. Defaults to “.”.

vegphenome.basephenome.utils.save_results_cv(detected_cucumber, cropedPatches, predPoints, corrected_imgs, fname, save_path='results')¶

Save images of results to visualize

Parameters

  • detected_cucumber ([np.array]) – Detection result from detectron2 visualized on RGB image

  • cropedPatches ([List[np.array]]) – Croped patch of original Image RGB images

  • predPoints ([List[Tuple]]) – predicted keypoints adjusted according to cropped patches

  • corrected_imgs ([List[np.array]]) – orientation corrected Image

  • fname ([str]) – Filename for saving postfix

  • save_path ([str]) – “Path to save”

vegphenome.basephenome.utils.vis_phenotypes(img, items, labels, line_width=5)¶

Visualize phenotype and return the list of vis_images. Decides on type of vis by number of points in each item

Parameters

  • img ([np.array]) – Image

  • items ([List[List]]) – List of items to visualize

  • labels ([List[str]]) – Lables

  • line_width (int, optional) – width of item to be drawn on image. Defaults to 5.

Returns

fig and list of vis_mage

Return type

[pyplot.fig,List[np.array]]

Parameters

  • num_cls (int, optional) – Number of classes. Defaults to 1.
